summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 17,465, entitled, "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Third Avenue North, in the City of Seattle, from Aloha Street to a point one hundred twenty (120) feet south of Galer Street, by constructing a sewer therein, of proper dimensions and material, together with all wyes, manholes, catch basins, flush tanks and other appurtenances necessary for the proper sewering and draining of said street, in accordance with Resolution No. 977 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the Charter and Ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved one the twenty-fifth day of November, 1907.
